meanings.definition: A formal dance, especially one held for a high school or college class at the end of the academic year.
meanings.sent1: The students were excited to attend the prom and dance the night away.
meanings.sent2: She wore a beautiful dress to the prom and had a great time with her friends.
meanings.sent3: At the prom, the students showed off their fancy outfits and danced to the music.
meanings.sent4: The prom was like a magical night where dreams came true under the twinkling lights.
meanings.sent5: The prom was a memorable event that marked the end of the school year.

meanings.definition: To promote or publicize (a product or idea).
meanings.sent1: They decided to prom their new line of products through social media.
meanings.sent2: The company used influencers to prom their latest campaign to a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: He tried to prom his homemade cookies by offering free samples to everyone.
meanings.sent4: She managed to prom her artwork by showcasing it at a popular gallery.
meanings.sent5: The team worked hard to prom their innovative solution to the community.

meanings.sent1: The colorful prom caught the attention of many shoppers passing by.
meanings.sent2: The company created a catchy prom to attract more customers to their store.
meanings.sent3: The funny prom on TV made everyone laugh and remember the brand.
meanings.sent4: She designed a creative prom that showcased the benefits of the new product.
meanings.sent5: The prom in the newspaper was so eye-catching that it drew in a lot of readers.
